info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT RANDOLPH...SOUTHWESTERN POCAHONTAS... NICHOLAS...LEWIS...BRAXTON...UPSHUR...WEBSTER...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY... SOUTHERN BARBOUR AND CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 117 PM EDT, a snow squall was located near Camden On Gauley, or 12 miles northeast of Summersville, moving east at 40 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Weston, Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Rainelle, Sutton, Audra State Park, Webster Springs, Babcock State Park, Belington, Ansted, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Gauley Bridge, Camden-On-gauley, Dailey and Birch River. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 52 and 104. Route 19 between mile markers 16 and 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.
